newsitem.title: BRAZIL: BRAZIL TO OPEN BIDS FOR TWO MORE B BAND CELL AREAS.
newsitem.headline: BRAZIL TO OPEN BIDS FOR TWO MORE B BAND CELL AREAS.

text.p: Brazil's Communications Ministry will open bids Friday morning on two more B Band cellular concessions, including one covering non-metropolitan Sao Paulo state, officials said.

Ministry officials at 0900 local/1200 gmt are set to open bid envelopes for Sao Paulo state area No. 2 as well as area No. 10, comprising the six northeastern states of Alagoas, Ceara, Paraiba, Pernambuco, Piaui and Rio Grande do Norte.

The governmment has set a base price of 600 million reais for area No. 2. But analysts, citing the region's wealth, population and pent-up demand for telecommunications service, expect bidders to offer premiums of 100 percent or more for the licence.
Last month, BCP S.A. group won bidding on area No. 1 covering Sao Paulo city with a stunning 2.64 billion-real ($2.45 billion) bid, some 333 percent above the base price.
For area No. 10, officials have set a 230 million-real minimum price.
Areas 2 and 10 would be the fourth and fifth concessions granted so far in the government's plan to auction 10 B Band licences covering Brazil. Bids were received in April on all but one area.
The B Band selloff is part of the government's plan to privatize the country's massive telecommunications sector which, after China, is considered the world's most-promising emerging telecoms market.
